ä¿‚ProbabilityğŸ˜…ğŸ˜…ğŸ˜…

The final score of an English course is known to be normally distributed with a mean of 55 and a standard deviation of 10. There are four grades to be awarded the the student and by convention 10%,25%,30% and 35% of the students will ultimately get grades of A, B, C and D respectively.

If six students are randomly and independently selected, what is the probability that at least two of them will obtain a grade D?
